DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Pathology Report Slide Not Consistent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the slide consistent with the findings of the Diagnostic Pathology Report.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Pathology Report Slide Finding Not Consistent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of a condition._A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread._A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of a condition.:A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread.

Concepts.definition: Characteristic or indicative of a condition.

A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread.

Property.preferredName: Slide Device Component Finding Negation Consistent
Property.preferredDefinition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.

Concepts.definition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
